title: Here are the 35 House Republicans who voted for the January 6 commission
body: Here are the 35 House Republicans who voted for the January 6 commission By Paul LeBlanc, CNNUpdated 9:18 PM ET, Wed May 19, 2021 JUST WATCHEDWatch the moment the House passes bill to create January 6 commissionReplayMore Videos ...MUST WATCH (16 Videos)Watch the moment the House passes bill to create January 6 commissionChicago mayor only granting interviews to people of colorVoters react to GOP lawmaker's apparent hypocrisy on Capitol riot'Holy cow': See Rep. Ryan's stunned reaction to House voteNY AG has been looking into taxes of Trump Organization CFO for monthsMan who pointed gun at protesters outside his home launches Senate run'There is this bloodthirstiness going on in our party': GOP Arizona election officialJoe Biden singles out Russia and China in commencement addressMcConnell: I made my views about January 6 very clearHear what Republicans are saying about Kevin McCarthy's move'Just disappeared': Veteran combat pilot describes UFO sightingDemocratic House chair calls McCarthy 'weak and cowardly'Lemon: Just another chapter in the saga of GOP hypocrisyTrump orgnaization New York attorney general introduces 'criminal capacity' to Trump probeNew York Gov. Cuomo to receive over $5 million from book deal'Complete abdication': Borger slams McCarthy's announcement (CNN)Thirty-five House Republican broke ranks Wednesday evening to support legislation that would establish an independent commission to investigate the January 6 insurrection at the US Capitol.The bill now moves to the Senate where it faces an uncertain fate as GOP resistance is growing.The GOP defections in the House showcased a significant break with Republican leadership in the chamber and former President Donald Trump, who had urged members to vote against the legislation.Here are the House Republicans who broke with their party:Liz Cheney of WyomingRead MoreTom Rice of South CarolinaDan Newhouse of Washington Anthony Gonzalez of OhioAdam Kinzinger of IllinoisFred Upton of MichiganJaime Herrera Beutler of WashingtonPeter Meijer of MichiganJohn Katko of New YorkDavid Valadao of California Tom Reed of New YorkDon Bacon of NebraskaJohn Curtis of UtahBrian Fitzpatrick of PennsylvaniaAndrew Garbarino of New YorkTony Gonzales of TexasDusty Johnson of South DakotaDavid Joyce of OhioChris Smith of New JerseyVan Taylor of TexasChris Jacobs of New YorkDavid McKinley of West VirginiaJeff Fortenberry of NebraskaMaria Elvira Salazar of FloridaMariannette Miller-Meeks of IowaSteve Womack of ArkansasStephanie Bice of OklahomaFrench Hill of ArkansasMike Simpson of IdahoRodney Davis of IllinoisBlake Moore of UtahMichael Guest of Mississippi Trey Hollingsworth of Indiana Carlos Gimenez of FloridaCliff Bentz of OregonWatch the moment the House passes bill to create January 6 commissionChicago mayor only granting interviews to people of colorVoters react to GOP lawmaker's apparent hypocrisy on Capitol riot'Holy cow': See Rep. Cuomo to receive over $5 million from book deal'Complete abdication': Borger slams McCarthy's announcement
